channel.title: NTP Public Time Servers on NTP: Network Time Protocol
channel.description: Recent content in NTP Public Time Servers on NTP: Network Time Protocol

item.title: Access Details
item.description: Access Policy details for this Time Server.

item.title: Access Policy
item.description: The general access policy of a Time Server. The following choices are available: Open Access - This Time Server is open to any client complying with the Usage Guidelines. Restricted Access - This Time Server has some access restrictions in addition to the Usage Guidelines. Closed Access - This Time Server is closed or requires prior arrangement for use. Usage Guidelines The following usage guidelines apply to all Time Servers unless modified by the Time Server operator:

item.title: Autokey
item.description: If this option is set to yes this Time Server supports NTP Authentication using the Autokey protocol. See the AutoKey URL field and/or the Notes in the Time Server list entry for information about obtaining the Autokey parameters.

item.title: Autokey URL
item.description: URL or email address for requesting the Autokey parameters for a Time Server.

item.title: Closed Access
item.description: Closed access Time Servers may not be used without prior arrangement. Usage Guidelines The following usage guidelines apply to all Time Servers unless modified by the Time Server operator: iburst may be used. burst may not be used. minpoll/maxpoll may not be changed below the defaults of 64 seconds and 1024 seconds, respectively. Clients should honor the KOD message. Time Server IP addresses and/or hostnames may not be hard-coded in any hardware, firmware, or software without advance explicit written permission from the Time Server operator.

item.title: Country Code
item.description: The country name, as specified in the ISO 3166-1-alpha-2 code list, where this Time Server is located. Time Servers located in the United States should use US NN where NN is the 2 letter abbreviation of the state.

item.title: Geographic Coordinates
item.description: The geographic coordinates of this Time Server.

item.title: Host Organization
item.description: The sponsoring organization, owner, or hosting provider of this Time Server.

item.title: Notification Message
item.description: Time Server operators which require a client to send a Notification Message prior to use must set the Access Policy to Restricted Access. When this option is set to Yes in a Time Server’s list entry, clients should send an email to the Server Contact announcing their intent to use the Time Server.

item.title: NTP Pool Time Servers
item.description: The NTP Pool Project uses DNS round robin to make a random selection from a pool of time servers who have volunteered to be in the pool. This is usually good enough for end-users. The minimal ntpd configuration file (e.g. /etc/ntpd.conf) for using NTP Pool Project is: driftfile /var/lib/ntp/ntp.drift server 0.pool.ntp.org server 1.pool.ntp.org server 2.pool.ntp.org server 3.pool.ntp.org Questions about the NTP Pool Project server pool should be directed to the NTP Pool Project mailing lists.

item.title: Open Access
item.description: An open access Time Server may be polled by any client complying with the Usage Guidelines. Clients should respect any declared Service Area, but are not required to do so. Operators of open access Time Servers may request, but may not require, a Notification Message prior to use. Usage Guidelines The following usage guidelines apply to all Time Servers unless modified by the Time Server operator: iburst may be used.

item.title: Pool Member
item.description: This Time Server is included in the NTP Pool Project if this option is set to Yes.

item.title: Restricted Access
item.description: A restricted access Time Server does not require a prior arrangement before use but has some usage restrictions in addition to the Usage Guidlines. These restrictions include, but are not limited to: Requiring a Notification Message prior to use Service only to clients within a specified Service Area Service only to certain types of institutions Maximum number of clients Minimum poll interval Users are reponsible for reviewing and following the information in the Time Server’s list entry prior to use.

item.title: Rules of Engagement
item.description: As the load on the hosts supporting NTP primary (stratum 1) time service is heavy and always increasing, clients should avoid using the primary servers whenever possible. In most cases the accuracy of the NTP secondary (stratum 2) servers is only slightly degraded relative to the primary servers and, as a group, the secondary servers may be just as reliable. As a general rule, a secondary server should use a primary server only under the following conditions:

item.title: Server Contact
item.description: The email address for contacting the Time Server operator. Inclusion of the operator’s name or telephone number is optional.

item.title: Server Location
item.description: The physical location, such as city, state, or province, of this Time Server.

item.title: Server Stratum
item.description: The Time Server stratum is the position at which a Time Server operates in the NTP hierarchy. A Stratum One Time Server is directly connected to a reference clock and is at the top of the Time Server hierarchy. A Stratum Two Time Server receives the time from one or more Stratum One Time Servers. Stratum Two Time Servers are not significantly less accurate than Stratum One Time Servers. Use the Inactive option of Server Stratum to mark a Time Server as inactive.

item.title: Server Synchronization
item.description: Information about how this Time Server is synchronized. Some operators include information about the server hardware, operating system, and version of NTP.

item.title: Servers Authenticated With Autokey
item.description: Stratum ISO Hostname Access Notify Contact Last Modified Stratum One DE ntp01.sixtopia.net Open Access No ntp@sixtopia.net 2021-02-10 Stratum One HR time1.ntp.hr Open Access Yes www.ntp.hr 2020-07-30 Stratum One IT ntp1.inrim.it Open Access Yes Giuseppe Vizio 2007-01-24 Stratum One IT ntp2.inrim.it Open Access Yes Giuseppe Vizio 2019-12-20 Stratum One RU ntp.scx.ru Closed Access Yes Victor Gerasimov 2006-06-19 Stratum Two RU ntp4.

item.title: Service Area
item.description: The geographic or network area this Time Server is intended to serve.

item.title: Symmetric Key
item.description: If this option is set to yes this Time Server supports NTP authentication using a symmetric key (shared secret). See the Symmetric Key URL field and the Notes in the Time Server’s list entry for information about obtaining the Symmetric Key.

item.title: Symmetric Key Type
item.description: The symmetric key type supported by this Time Server.

item.title: Symmetric Key URL
item.description: URL or email address for requesting a Time Server’s Symmetric Key.

item.title: Time Server
item.description: A Time Server is a system which acquires the correct time from a local reference clock or remote time servers and will answer time requests from other systems.

item.title: Use DNS
item.description: If this option is set to Yes users should put the hostname in their ntp.conf file instead of the IP address.
